article_title: Teens, Like Adults, Function Better With Enough Sleep — Letters to the Editor
article_text: It is abundantly clear that teenagers in this country aren't getting enough sleep and that sleep deprivation contributes to poor academic performance ("Teens Need School to Start Later, Doctors Say," U.S. News, Aug. 25 and "More Schools Consider Later Start Times for Teenagers," Personal Journal, Aug. 26). However, delaying school start times addresses only one side of the equation. While it appears that physiologically it is easier for adolescents to stay up later at night, the failure of parents to set and enforce healthy bedtimes and place limits on electronic distractions in their bedrooms is...
